column4: Anyone able to help with getting libtcl8.4.so.0 seen by a program?
yep
I am trying to run a program that needs that file, but it says that it cannot find it.
look in /usr/lib for libtcl8.4.so
actually in /lib
I have and it is there. I have also used ldconfig | grep libtcl and it is recognised.
make a symlink to it
Okaly. How do I do that?
ln -s libtcl8.4.so /lib/libtcl8.4.so.0
assuming your in that directory
It says that the file already exists. Shall I delete this file (or move it) and do it again?
what file?
/lib/libtcl8.4.so.0
then your program should find it
That's what I thought. I shall try renaming the old file and doing it again and then reboot. See if it picks up on it.
you could try symlinking it to /usr/lib
Okay. Thank you. I'll give that a try first.
I have managed to get it reading the file, but now I get 'cannot open share object file: error 40'
thats too bad :-)
So any ideas where I can go from here?
not sure
Okay. Thanks for your help though. I'll have a look/ask around and see if I can solve it
Just thought I would let you know, the problem with libtcl that I've been having? It's actually a problem with the program. Typical! :)
yer, tipical :-)
